name: Haemi
description: Haemi International Catholic Martyrs' Shrine commemorates over 1,000 unknown martyrs buried alive during 1866-1882 persecutions, representing profound Catholic witness in Korea.

name: Elele
description: Elele is home to the International Sanctuary of Jesus the Saviour and Mother Mary, one of Africa's largest Catholic pilgrimage centers founded by Fr. Edeh in 1985.

name: Knock
description: Knock Shrine is Ireland's International Eucharistic and Marian Shrine where an apparition of the Blessed Virgin Mary, St. Joseph and St. John appeared in 1879.

name: Stary Wielisław
description: Stary Wielisław is home to the International Shrine of Our Lady of Sorrows, a sacred pilgrimage site dating back to the 10th century, officially established by Pope Boniface VIII in 1300.

name: Padua
description: Padua is a major Catholic pilgrimage destination housing the relics of St. Anthony of Padua, one of the Church's most beloved saints, attracting millions of faithful to his magnificent basilica.

name: Antipolo
description: Antipolo is renowned as the Pilgrimage Capital of the Philippines, home to the International Shrine of Our Lady of Peace and Good Voyage, attracting millions of Marian devotees annually.

name: Malayattoor
description: Malayattoor is home to an international Catholic shrine dedicated to St. Thomas the Apostle, drawing millions of pilgrims to its hilltop sanctuary.

name: Kraków
description: Kraków is a profound Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the Divine Mercy Sanctuary where St. Faustina's tomb resides and beloved by Pope John Paul II.

name: Loreto
description: Loreto houses the Holy House of the Virgin Mary, believed to be the home where Jesus grew up and where Mary received the Annunciation. This holy site has drawn Catholic pilgrims for centuries.

name: Lourdes
description: Lourdes is renowned worldwide as a Catholic pilgrimage site where the Virgin Mary appeared to St. Bernadette in 1858, offering hope and healing through sacred waters.

name: Aglona
description: Aglona is Latvia's most important Catholic pilgrimage site, home to the Basilica of the Assumption with its miraculous 17th-century icon of Our Lady.

name: Fátima\n\n
description: Fátima is one of the world's most important Catholic pilgrimage sites, where the Virgin Mary appeared to three shepherd children in 1917.

name: Seoul
description: Seoul is home to Asia's first official Catholic pilgrimage route, featuring the historic Myeongdong Cathedral and sacred sites commemorating Korean martyrs.

name: Vendeville
description: Vendeville is home to the renowned Sanctuary of Saint Rita, drawing Catholic pilgrims seeking the intercession of the patron saint of impossible causes through year-round devotions.

name: Šiluva
description: Šiluva is Lithuania's most important Marian pilgrimage site, where Our Lady appeared in 1608, bringing thousands back to Catholic faith after the Reformation.

name: Vilnius
description: Vilnius holds profound Catholic significance as home to the original Divine Mercy image and sacred relics of St. Casimir, Lithuania's patron saint.

name: Gibraltar
description: Gibraltar offers a unique Catholic pilgrimage experience with the historic Shrine of Our Lady of Europe, patroness of the territory, dating to the 14th century and deeply revered by locals.

name: Mexico City
description: Mexico City is home to the world's most visited Catholic pilgrimage site, the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe, where the Virgin Mary appeared to Juan Diego in 1531.

name: Filipov
description: Filipov is a significant Marian pilgrimage site in the Czech Republic, known for the 1866 apparition of the Virgin Mary to Magdalene Kade and subsequent miraculous healings.

name: Șumuleu Ciuc
description: Șumuleu Ciuc hosts Romania's largest Catholic pilgrimage, drawing 300,000 pilgrims annually for Pentecost celebrations at its Franciscan basilica.

name: Máriapócs
description: Máriapócs is Hungary's most important Greek Catholic pilgrimage site, famous for its miraculous weeping icon of the Virgin Mary that has drawn faithful since 1696.

name: Beauraing
description: Beauraing became a major Catholic pilgrimage site after 33 Marian apparitions to five children in 1932-1933, where Mary appeared as the Virgin of the Golden Heart.

name: Le Puy-en-Velay
description: Le Puy-en-Velay is one of France's oldest Marian pilgrimage sites, home to the Black Virgin and a major starting point for the Camino de Santiago.

name: Einsiedeln
description: Einsiedeln Abbey is Switzerland's largest pilgrimage site, home to the miraculous Black Madonna and continuous pilgrimage since St. Meinrad's hermitage in the 9th century.

name: Paray-le-Monial
description: Paray-le-Monial is the sacred site where Jesus revealed His Sacred Heart to St. Margaret Mary Alacoque, establishing it as a major Catholic pilgrimage destination.

name: Częstochowa
description: Częstochowa is Poland's most important Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the miraculous Black Madonna icon at Jasna Góra Monastery, the spiritual heart of Polish Catholicism.

name: La Salette
description: La Salette is a major Catholic pilgrimage site where the Virgin Mary appeared to two children in 1846, bringing a message of reconciliation and conversion.

name: Souvigny
description: Souvigny is a historic Catholic pilgrimage destination housing the tombs of Saint Mayeul and Saint Odilo, two great abbots of Cluny. This peaceful sanctuary draws pilgrims seeking spiritual reflection.

name: Ars
description: Ars is home to the shrine of St. John Vianney, the patron saint of parish priests. This holy site attracts pilgrims seeking spiritual renewal.

name: Mellieħa
description: Mellieħa hosts Malta's oldest Marian shrine, the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Mellieħa, dating to 60 AD with traditions linking it to St. Paul and St. Luke.

name: Kibeho
description: Kibeho is the only Vatican-approved Marian apparition site in Africa, where the Virgin Mary appeared to schoolgirls between 1981-1989.

name: Paris
description: Paris hosts magnificent Catholic heritage including Notre-Dame Cathedral and the Miraculous Medal shrine, making it a profound pilgrimage destination.

name: Levoča
description: Levoča is Slovakia's most important Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the Basilica of the Visitation where tens of thousands gather annually.

name: Alençon
description: Alençon is the birthplace of Saint Thérèse of Lisieux and home to the Basilica of Notre-Dame where her parents Saints Louis and Zélie Martin were married.

name: Cotignac
description: Cotignac is the world's only village where all three members of the Holy Family appeared, making it a premier Catholic pilgrimage destination in Provence.

name: Rome
description: Rome, the Eternal City, is the heart of Catholicism and seat of the Pope, drawing millions of pilgrims annually to sacred sites.

name: Mont-Saint-Michel
description: Mont-Saint-Michel is a majestic medieval abbey dedicated to Archangel Michael, serving as one of Europe's most important Catholic pilgrimage destinations for over a millennium.

name: Walsingham
description: Walsingham is England's premier Marian pilgrimage site, known as 'England's Nazareth' since the 11th century when the Virgin Mary appeared to Lady Richeldis.

name: Sainte-Anne-d'Auray
description: Sainte-Anne-d'Auray is Brittany's most important pilgrimage site where Saint Anne appeared in 1624, making it France's third major Catholic shrine.

name: Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer
description: This historic Camargue village houses relics of the Three Marys and Saint Sarah, drawing pilgrims since medieval times with annual May and October processions to the sea.

name: Saint-Étienne-le-Laus
description: Saint-Étienne-le-Laus is a renowned Catholic pilgrimage site where Our Lady appeared to shepherdess Benoîte Rencurel from 1664-1718, drawing 200,000 annual visitors.

name: Zarvanytsia
description: Zarvanytsia is Ukraine's most revered Marian pilgrimage site, home to the miraculous Mother of God icon since the 13th century.

name: Banneux
description: Banneux is renowned for the 1933 Marian apparitions of Our Lady of the Poor to Mariette Beco, drawing pilgrims seeking healing and spiritual guidance.

name: Mariazell
description: Mariazell is Austria's most important Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the miraculous statue of Our Lady of Mariazell, drawing over one million pilgrims annually.

name: Lisieux
description: Lisieux is France's second most important Catholic pilgrimage site after Lourdes, dedicated to St. Thérèse of the Child Jesus.

name: Pontmain
description: Pontmain is a major Marian pilgrimage site where Our Lady appeared to four children in 1871, bringing hope during the Franco-Prussian War.

name: Vézelay
description: Vézelay is a major Catholic pilgrimage site housing relics of St. Mary Magdalene. This UNESCO World Heritage basilica was a starting point for the Way of St. James.

name: Brive
description: Brive is home to the ancient Caves of Saint Anthony of Padua, where pilgrims have sought spiritual refuge since the 13th century.

name: Rocamadour
description: Rocamadour is a spectacular cliffside pilgrimage site famous for its Black Madonna statue and miraculous healing powers, attracting kings and saints since the Middle Ages.

name: Lalouvesc
description: Lalouvesc is a renowned Catholic pilgrimage site where the Jesuit missionary Saint Jean-François Régis died and is buried, attracting pilgrims seeking his intercession since 1640.

name: Zaragoza
description: Zaragoza is home to the first Marian sanctuary in Christianity, the Basilica of Our Lady of the Pillar, where the Virgin Mary appeared to St. James the Apostle.

name: Leżajsk
description: Leżajsk is home to the miraculous 16th-century Marian shrine where Our Lady appeared, crowned by Pope Benedict XIV in 1752.

name: Altötting
description: Altötting, Germany's oldest Marian shrine, has been a pilgrimage destination for over 500 years, renowned for the Black Madonna and countless healings attributed to Our Lady's intercession since the miracle of 1489.

name: Gietrzwałd
description: Gietrzwałd is Poland's only Church-approved Marian apparition site, known as the \Polish Lourdes\" where Our Lady appeared in 1877."

name: Għarb
description: Għarb hosts Malta's most important Catholic pilgrimage site, the National Shrine of Ta' Pinu, renowned for miraculous apparitions and deep Marian devotion.

name: Heiloo
description: Heiloo hosts the Netherlands' largest Marian pilgrimage site, the Sanctuary of Onze Lieve Vrouw ter Nood, with roots dating back to Saint Willibrord's miracles in 690.

name: Varallo Sesia
description: Varallo Sesia is home to the oldest Sacro Monte, a UNESCO World Heritage site founded in 1491 as a 'New Jerusalem' for Catholic pilgrims unable to travel to the Holy Land.

name: Nice
description: Nice features the national sanctuary Our Lady Help of Christians, a Catholic pilgrimage destination with beautiful art deco architecture and deep Marian devotion.

name: Edinburgh
description: Edinburgh offers Catholic pilgrims the National Shrine of St Andrew at St Mary's Cathedral, Scotland's premier Catholic pilgrimage destination with over 200 years of sacred heritage.

name: Madrid
description: Madrid serves as a key Catholic pilgrimage gateway to Spain, featuring the magnificent Almudena Cathedral and serving as starting point for Camino de Santiago journeys.

name: Holywell
description: Holywell hosts St Winefride's Well, Britain's oldest continuously visited pilgrimage site with 1,400 years of Catholic healing tradition.

name: Chartres
description: Chartres Cathedral houses the sacred Veil of the Virgin Mary, drawing pilgrims for nearly 1,000 years to this Gothic masterpiece and major Marian sanctuary.

name: London
description: London's Westminster Cathedral stands as the mother church for Catholics in England and Wales, featuring spectacular Byzantine architecture and daily Eucharistic adoration.

name: Trieste
description: Trieste offers Catholic pilgrims the renowned National Shrine of Mary Mother and Queen at Monte Grisa, built as a symbol of peace after WWII salvation.

name: Orselina
description: Orselina houses the famous Madonna del Sasso sanctuary, founded after a 1480 Marian apparition and one of Switzerland's most important Catholic pilgrimage sites.

name: Crediton
description: Crediton houses the National Shrine of St Boniface, the great Anglo-Saxon missionary born here in 680 who became patron saint of Germany and Devon.

name: El Rocío
description: El Rocío is a major Catholic pilgrimage destination housing the revered Virgin of El Rocío statue, drawing over a million pilgrims annually during Pentecost.

name: Reims
description: Reims is the historic coronation site of French kings and home to magnificent Gothic cathedrals. This sacred city draws Catholic pilgrims to witness where Clovis was baptized and monarchs were crowned.

name: Pompeii
description: Pompeii is home to the renowned Pontifical Shrine of Our Lady of the Rosary, drawing millions of Catholic pilgrims annually to experience miraculous Marian devotion.

name: Santiago de Compostela
description: Santiago de Compostela is one of Christianity's most important pilgrimage destinations, housing the tomb of Apostle Saint James the Greater and drawing millions of faithful since the 9th century.

name: Faversham
description: Faversham hosts England's National Shrine of Saint Jude, a major Catholic pilgrimage center with relics of the Apostle and medieval devotional art.

name: Scherpenheuvel-Zichem
description: Scherpenheuvel-Zichem is Belgium's most important Marian pilgrimage site, home to the Basilica of Our Lady of Scherpenheuvel, a revered center of Catholic devotion.

name: Farnborough
description: Farnborough houses England's National Shrine to St Joseph at St Michael's Abbey, a Benedictine monastery attracting Catholic pilgrims seeking spiritual reflection.

name: Croagh Patrick
description: Croagh Patrick is Ireland's holy mountain where St. Patrick fasted for 40 days and continues as the nation's most important Catholic pilgrimage destination.

name: Motherwell
description: Motherwell serves as a significant Catholic pilgrimage center with the renowned Carfin Grotto, Scotland's National Shrine to Our Lady of Lourdes, attracting over 70,000 pilgrims annually.

name: Montserrat
description: Montserrat is home to the revered Black Madonna and Benedictine monastery, drawing pilgrims to its sacred mountain sanctuary for centuries of spiritual devotion.

name: Canterbury
description: Canterbury is home to St Thomas of Canterbury Church, housing the shrine and relics of St Thomas Becket, making it England's premier Catholic pilgrimage destination.

name: Brielle
description: Brielle is a national Catholic pilgrimage site commemorating the 1572 martyrdom of 19 priests and monks, now venerated as the Martyrs of Gorcum who were canonized in 1867.

name: Valladolid
description: Valladolid's magnificent Cathedral serves as the spiritual heart of this historic Spanish city, housing sacred art and architectural treasures.

name: Koekelberg
description: The National Basilica of the Sacred Heart in Koekelberg is Belgium's premier Catholic pilgrimage destination, dedicated to the Sacred Heart of Jesus as a national sanctuary.

name: Cologne
description: Cologne Cathedral houses the Shrine of the Three Kings, making it one of Northern Europe's most important Catholic pilgrimage sites.

name: Assisi
description: Assisi is the birthplace of St. Francis and St. Clare, making it one of Catholicism's most significant pilgrimage destinations with profound spiritual heritage.

name: Drogheda
description: Drogheda is home to St Peter's Church, which houses the shrine of St Oliver Plunkett, Ireland's last martyred archbishop, making it a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination.

name: Cardigan
description: Cardigan is home to Wales' National Catholic Shrine, Our Lady of the Taper, a revered Marian pilgrimage site with medieval origins.

name: Shkodër
description: Shkodër is the historic center of Catholicism in Albania, home to the country's most important Catholic shrines and a pilgrimage destination for Albanian Catholics.

name: Karlovac
description: Karlovac is home to the National Shrine of Saint Joseph, Croatia's premier Catholic pilgrimage destination dedicated to the nation's patron saint.

name: Niepokalanów
description: Niepokalanów is a major Catholic pilgrimage center founded by St. Maximilian Kolbe, known as the City of the Immaculate Mother of God.

name: Trzebnica
description: Trzebnica hosts the Sanctuary of Saint Jadwiga, a major Catholic pilgrimage site housing the tomb of Saint Hedwig of Silesia, drawing pilgrims since the 14th century.

name: Plovdiv
description: Plovdiv is home to the magnificent Cathedral of St. Louis, the largest Catholic church in Bulgaria and a significant pilgrimage destination.

name: Zakopane
description: Zakopane serves as a spiritual gateway to the Tatra Mountains, featuring the National Shrine of Our Lady of Fatima, built as a votive offering after the 1981 assassination attempt on Pope John Paul II.

name: Budslaw
description: Budslaw is home to the miraculous Our Lady of Budslau icon, Belarus's national Catholic sanctuary attracting tens of thousands of pilgrims annually.

name: Matraverebély-Szentkut
description: Hungary's national Catholic shrine since the 12th century, Matraverebély-Szentkút draws pilgrims to its miraculous spring and Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption.

name: Šibenik
description: Šibenik offers pilgrims the magnificent Cathedral of St. James, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and the national shrine dedicated to Croatia's first saint, Nikola Tavelić.

name: Góra Świętej Anny
description: Góra Świętej Anny is a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination featuring a miraculous statue of St. Anne and an impressive calvary with Franciscan monastery.

name: Marija Bistrica
description: Marija Bistrica is Croatia's largest Marian pilgrimage site, home to the miraculous Black Madonna statue and national shrine.

name: Brezje
description: Brezje is Slovenia's national Marian shrine, home to the Basilica of Mary Help of Christians where pilgrims venerate a miraculous icon since 1865.

name: Montréal
description: Montréal is a prominent Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the ornate Notre-Dame Basilica—famous for its Gothic Revival architecture and intricate interior—and Saint Joseph's Oratory of Mount Royal, the world's largest shrine dedicated to Saint Joseph, attracting millions of visitors annually.

name: Cap-de-la-Madeleine
description: Home to Our Lady of the Cape Shrine, Cap-de-la-Madeleine is Canada's national Marian shrine with miraculous origins dating to 1888.

name: Kahnawake
description: Kahnawake is home to the National Shrine of Saint Kateri Tekakwitha, the first Native American saint, whose tomb draws Catholic pilgrims seeking her intercession.

name: Lac-Bouchette
description: Ermitage Saint-Antoine is a major Catholic pilgrimage site in Quebec, founded in 1907 and known for its miraculous healings and spiritual significance.

name: Wakaw
description: St. Theresa Parish, the National Shrine of the Little Flower in Wakaw, Saskatchewan, offers pilgrims a sacred destination for spiritual renewal and devotion.

name: Winnipeg
description: Winnipeg serves as a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to Canada's second martyr's shrine at St. Joseph's Ukrainian Catholic Church, where the holy relics of Blessed Bishop Vasyl Velychkovsky are enshrined.

name: Berdychiv
description: Berdychiv is Ukraine's premier Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the miraculous Our Lady of Berdychiv icon crowned by Pope Benedict XIV in 1756.

name: Toronto
description: Toronto offers Catholic pilgrims sacred spaces including St. Michael's Cathedral Basilica and significant shrines honoring Canada's martyrs and Marian devotion.

name: Ottawa
description: Ottawa offers Catholic pilgrims the magnificent Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica, a National Historic Site and spiritual heart of Canada's capital since 1847.

name: Midland
description: Midland's Martyrs' Shrine is a national Catholic pilgrimage site honoring eight Jesuit saints martyred over 350 years ago while bringing Christianity to Canada.

name: Sainte-Anne-de-Beaupré
description: Sainte-Anne-de-Beaupré is North America's oldest Catholic pilgrimage site, drawing over half-million pilgrims annually to venerate St. Anne, grandmother of Jesus.

name: Šaštín-Stráže
description: Šaštín-Stráže hosts Slovakia's most important Marian shrine, the Basilica of Our Lady of Seven Sorrows, patron saint of Slovakia.

name: Pietralcina
description: Pietrelcina is the sacred birthplace of Saint Padre Pio, where this beloved 20th-century saint was baptized and spent his formative years, drawing pilgrims seeking spiritual connection.

name: Gostyń
description: Gostyń is home to the Basilica of Święta Góra, the main Marian sanctuary of the Poznań archdiocese and a masterpiece of Pompeo Ferrari.

name: Steingaden
description: Steingaden is home to the famous Pilgrimage Church of Wies, built after a miraculous weeping statue was discovered in 1738, attracting Catholic pilgrims seeking the Scourged Saviour's intercession.

name: Walldürn
description: Walldürn hosts Germany's largest Eucharistic pilgrimage, centered on the famous 1330 blood miracle where Christ appeared on the consecrated host during Mass.

name: Durham
description: Durham Cathedral houses the Shrine of St Cuthbert, making it a major pilgrimage destination for Catholics seeking spiritual healing.

name: Studzianna
description: Studzianna is home to a renowned Marian sanctuary with the Basilica of St. Philip Neri and St. John the Baptist, attracting Catholic pilgrims for centuries.

name: Kalwaria Zebrzydowska
description: Kalwaria Zebrzydowska is a remarkable 17th-century Calvary sanctuary known as the 'Polish Jerusalem,' where over a million pilgrims annually pray along its Passion and Marian devotional paths.

name: Saint-Gilles
description: Saint-Gilles was once the fourth most important pilgrimage destination in Christendom, where the relics of Saint Gilles attracted countless pilgrims seeking miracles and blessings.

name: Marseille
description: Marseille is a major Catholic pilgrimage destination centered around the iconic Notre-Dame de la Garde basilica, known for its Assumption Day pilgrimages and Marian devotion.

name: Saint-Maximin-la-Sainte-Baume
description: Home to the relics of Saint Mary Magdalene, this major pilgrimage site features a Gothic basilica where pilgrims venerate the remains of the Apostle to the Apostles.

name: Burgos
description: Burgos Cathedral, a UNESCO World Heritage site, stands as a vital pilgrimage stop on the Camino de Santiago, housing the tomb of El Cid and offering profound spiritual significance for Catholic pilgrims seeking history and divine beauty.

name: Vadstena
description: Vadstena is home to the medieval Vadstena Abbey, founded by Saint Bridget of Sweden in the 14th century, making it a significant Catholic pilgrimage site.

name: Avignon
description: Avignon served as the seat of seven Popes from 1309-1378, making it a pivotal center of Catholic Church history. The city's magnificent Palace of the Popes and cathedral continue to attract faithful pilgrims seeking connection to this papal legacy.

name: Orvieto
description: Orvieto is famed for the Eucharistic Miracle of Bolsena, with relics preserved in its magnificent Gothic cathedral, drawing pilgrims worldwide.

name: Kalwaria Pacławska
description: Kalwaria Pacławska is a historic Catholic pilgrimage center known as the 'Jerusalem of the East,' featuring miraculous Marian devotions.

name: Caravaca de la Cruz
description: Caravaca de la Cruz is one of only five Holy Cities in the Catholic world, home to the miraculous Vera Cross relic and pilgrimage destination.

name: Toledo
description: Toledo stands as the historic heart of Spanish Catholicism, home to the magnificent Primatial Cathedral and serving as a center of Christian art and pilgrimage since the Reconquista.

name: Licheń Stary
description: Licheń Stary is Poland's largest Marian pilgrimage site, home to the magnificent Basilica of Our Lady of Licheń and the revered icon of Our Lady of Sorrows.

name: Plan-d'Aups-Sainte-Baume
description: Plan-d'Aups-Sainte-Baume is home to the ancient grotto where Mary Magdalene lived as a hermit, making it one of Christianity's oldest pilgrimage sites.

name: Aachen
description: Aachen Cathedral houses four great relics and hosts the Heiligtumsfahrt pilgrimage every seven years since 1349, attracting faithful to venerate treasures collected by Charlemagne.

name: Studzieniczna
description: Studzieniczna is a renowned Marian pilgrimage site famous for its miraculous image of Our Lady and healing spring waters, visited by Pope John Paul II in 1999.

name: Naples
description: Naples Cathedral houses the miraculous blood of Saint Januarius and serves as the spiritual heart of Neapolitan Catholic devotion.

name: Žemaičių Kalvarija
description: Žemaičių Kalvarija is Lithuania's most important Catholic pilgrimage site, featuring the first Calvary in the Grand Duchy with its miraculous Holy Cross relic.

name: Tronheim
description: Trondheim houses Nidaros Cathedral, built over St. Olav's tomb, making it Norway's most important Catholic pilgrimage destination and northern Europe's premier medieval shrine.

name: Santo Toribio de Liébana
description: Santo Toribio de Liébana monastery houses the largest known relic of the True Cross, making it one of Catholicism's five holy sites with perpetual indulgences.

name: Godów
description: Godów is home to the historic wooden St. Anne's Church, a significant Catholic pilgrimage site in Silesia featuring religious art and sacred relics.

name: Lindisfarne
description: Lindisfarne, also known as Holy Island, is a sacred pilgrimage site where St. Aidan founded the first Celtic Christian monastery in 635 AD.

name: St Andrews
description: St Andrews holds profound Catholic significance as Scotland's premier pilgrimage destination where Saint Andrew's relics drew medieval pilgrims.

name: Lubaczów
description: Lubaczów is a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination in southeastern Poland, known for its Sanctuary of Our Lady of Graces and the nearby Sanctuary of Our Lady of Łukawiec.

name: Viru-Nigula
description: Viru-Nigula is Estonia's oldest Marian sanctuary, housing the ruins of 13th-century St. Mary's Chapel and hosting annual Catholic pilgrimages.

name: Whithorn
description: Whithorn is Scotland's earliest Christian pilgrimage site, home to St Ninian's shrine and Candida Casa, drawing pilgrims for over 1,600 years to seek healing and spiritual renewal.

name: Glasgow
description: Glasgow offers profound Catholic heritage with its medieval cathedral housing St Mungo's shrine, drawing pilgrims for centuries to Scotland's spiritual heart.

name: Taizé
description: Taizé is one of the world's most important Christian pilgrimage sites, attracting over 100,000 young people annually for prayer and reconciliation.

name: Dukla
description: Dukla is a significant Catholic pilgrimage site honoring St. John of Dukla, a 15th-century Franciscan saint canonized by Pope John Paul II in 1997.

name: Wadowice
description: Wadowice is the birthplace of Saint John Paul II, where pilgrims visit the basilica of his baptism and family home to honor the beloved pontiff's spiritual origins.

name: Penrhys
description: Penrhys is an ancient Catholic pilgrimage site high in the Rhondda Valley, famous for its miraculous statue of Our Lady and holy well dating to medieval times.

name: Avila
description: Ávila is the birthplace of St. Teresa of Ávila, renowned Doctor of the Church, and home to her relics and numerous sites associated with her mystical life.

name: Hill of the Crosses (Kryžių kalnas)
description: The Hill of Crosses is Lithuania's national pilgrimage center, where over 100,000 crosses testify to Catholic faith and peaceful resistance.

name: Turin
description: Turin is renowned as the guardian of the Holy Shroud, believed to be Christ's burial cloth, drawing Catholic pilgrims worldwide to venerate this sacred relic.

name: Kirkkokari (Saint Henry's Island)
description: Kirkkokari (Saint Henry's Island) is Finland's only Catholic pilgrimage site, marking the martyrdom of Bishop Henry in 1156. Medieval chapel foundations and modern altars commemorate this sacred place.

name: Monte Sant'Angelo
description: Monte Sant'Angelo hosts the oldest shrine in Western Europe dedicated to Archangel Michael, where tradition holds the celestial being consecrated the sanctuary himself.

name: Kildare
description: Kildare is home to St. Brigid's Cathedral, built on the site of Ireland's famous 5th-century monastery founded by St. Brigid, patroness of Ireland.

name: San Giovanni Rotondo
description: San Giovanni Rotondo is home to Saint Padre Pio's shrine, drawing millions to venerate this beloved stigmatic priest and experience his spiritual legacy.

name: Krasnobród
description: Krasnobród is home to the historic Shrine of Our Lady of the Visitation, a baroque sanctuary founded by Queen Marie Casimire Sobieska and a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination in southeastern Poland.

name: Loyola
description: Loyola is the birthplace of St. Ignatius of Loyola, founder of the Jesuit Order. The magnificent Baroque sanctuary surrounds his holy birthplace.

name: Bari
description: Bari is home to the Basilica of Saint Nicholas, housing the relics of Saint Nicholas, making it one of Europe's most important Catholic pilgrimage destinations.

name: Kodeń
description: Kodeń is a renowned Catholic pilgrimage site home to the miraculous icon of Our Lady of Kodeń, drawing faithful seeking Marian intercession.

name: Lębork
description: Lębork's Sanctuary of St. Jacob the Apostle has been a medieval pilgrimage center on the route to Santiago de Compostella, featuring a 14th-century Gothic church with sacred relics.

name: Caceres
description: Cáceres is home to the Royal Monastery of Santa María de Guadalupe, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of Spain's most important Catholic pilgrimage destinations, housing the revered image of Our Lady of Guadalupe, Patron Saint of Extremadura.

name: Nevers
description: Nevers is a significant Catholic pilgrimage site housing the incorrupt body of Saint Bernadette Soubirous, visionary of Lourdes.

name: Gniezno
description: Gniezno, the cradle of Polish Christianity, hosts the shrine of St. Adalbert and served as the coronation site for Polish kings.

name: Iona
description: Iona Abbey, founded by St. Columba in 563 AD, stands as one of Scotland's most sacred pilgrimage sites where Celtic Christianity flourished.

name: Tuchów
description: Tuchów is home to a renowned Marian sanctuary with a miraculous 16th-century icon, drawing pilgrims for its spiritual significance.

name: Wambierzyce
description: Wambierzyce is known as 'Silesian Jerusalem' and features a miraculous Marian shrine with centuries of pilgrimage tradition.

name: Lyon
description: Lyon serves as a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the historic Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière, a popular Marian shrine since 1170 that attracts pilgrims seeking spiritual reflection.

name: Tours
description: Tours houses the tomb of St. Martin of Tours, the 4th-century bishop renowned as the 'Apostle of Gaul,' making it a major pilgrimage site since the Middle Ages.

name: Piekary Śląskie
description: Piekary Śląskie is one of Poland's most important Marian shrines, drawing thousands of pilgrims annually to the miraculous image of Our Lady of Justice and Social Love (Matka Sprawiedliwości i Miłości Społeczne).

name: Seville
description: Seville's magnificent Cathedral houses the tomb of Saint Ferdinand III and draws pilgrims during Holy Week processions.

name: Montecassino
description: Montecassino Abbey, founded by St. Benedict in 529, is the birthplace of Western monasticism and houses the tombs of St. Benedict and St. Scholastica.

name: Kevelaer
description: Kevelaer is Germany's largest Catholic pilgrimage destination, where Our Lady of Consolation has been venerated since 1641 following miraculous apparitions and healings.

name: Cascia
description: Cascia is a renowned Catholic pilgrimage site in Umbria, home to Saint Rita and housing the miraculous Eucharistic Miracle, drawing the faithful worldwide.

name: Trakai
description: Trakai hosts the miraculous Trakai Mother of God icon, crowned by Pope Clement XI in 1718, drawing pilgrims since the 17th century to its renowned basilica.

name: Bamberg
description: Bamberg is a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination housing the tomb of Emperor Henry II and Pope Clement II in its magnificent cathedral.

name: Gidle
description: Gidle houses a renowned Dominican monastery with the miraculous figure of Our Lady, drawing Catholic pilgrims from across Poland seeking Marian devotion.

name: Kałków
description: Kałków is home to the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Sorrows, Queen of Poland, a major Marian pilgrimage site with miraculous icon and religious complex.

name: Manresa
description: Manresa is a pivotal Catholic pilgrimage site where St. Ignatius of Loyola spent 11 months in 1522, developing his Spiritual Exercises in the sacred cave.

name: Manoppello
description: Manoppello is home to the Holy Face of Jesus, believed to be Veronica's Veil, drawing pilgrims to witness this miraculous image of Christ.

name: Downpatrick
description: Downpatrick is revered as the burial place of Ireland's patron saint St Patrick, making it a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination in Northern Ireland.

name: Lanciano
description: Lanciano hosts the first recorded Eucharistic miracle in Catholic history, where host transformed to flesh and wine to blood in the 8th century.

name: Aylesford
description: Aylesford Priory, dating from 1242, is the oldest Carmelite foundation in England where St. Simon Stock received the Brown Scapular from Our Lady.

name: St. David's
description: St. Davids Cathedral, housing the shrine of Wales' patron saint, was granted papal privilege making two pilgrimages equal to one to Rome in the 12th century.

name: Bardo
description: Bardo houses the miraculous 13th-century Madonna statue and Baroque pilgrimage church visited by Pope John Paul II, making it a significant Marian pilgrimage destination in Poland.

name: Marianka
description: Marianka is Slovakia's oldest pilgrimage site, housing the miraculous statue of Virgin Mary and drawing faithful since medieval times.

name: Święta Lipka
description: Święta Lipka is Poland's oldest Marian sanctuary, renowned for its miraculous Virgin Mary statue and stunning Baroque basilica, drawing Catholic pilgrims for centuries.

name: Siena
description: Siena is home to St. Catherine of Siena, a Doctor of the Church, and contains her birthplace sanctuary and relics, making it a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination.

name: Oropa
description: The Sanctuary of Oropa is one of the oldest Marian shrines in the world, founded by Saint Eusebius around 371 AD in the Italian Alps.

name: Nitra
description: Nitra, Slovakia's oldest Christian center, houses St. Emmeram's Cathedral, dating to the 11th century. This historic pilgrimage destination offers deep spiritual significance as the seat of Slovakia's first Catholic diocese.

name: Pontevedra
description: Pontevedra offers pilgrims two significant Marian sanctuaries along the Portuguese Camino route, hosting the Virgin of the Pilgrim and Fatima apparitions.

name: Conques
description: Conques is a major medieval pilgrimage destination on the Camino de Santiago, home to the magnificent Abbey Church of Sainte-Foy with its famous reliquary and Romanesque treasures.

name: Bardsey Island (Ynys Enlli)
description: Bardsey Island, known as the 'Island of 20,000 Saints', has been a sacred Catholic pilgrimage destination since medieval times. Three pilgrimages here were considered equal to one to Rome.

name: Lough Derg
description: Lough Derg is one of Ireland's most ancient pilgrimage sites, dating back to the 5th century, where St. Patrick established a place of prayer and spiritual renewal that continues to draw faithful seeking deeper connection with God.

name: Canneto
description: Canneto is home to the Sanctuary of Santa Maria del Canneto, a revered Marian pilgrimage site dating to the 12th-13th centuries with annual summer pilgrimages.

name: Ludźmierz
description: Ludźmierz houses Poland's oldest Marian shrine, featuring the miraculous statue of Our Lady of Ludźmierz, Queen of Podhale, venerated since medieval times.

name: Trnava
description: Trnava, known as the Slovak Rome, is a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination centered around the miraculous Merciful Virgin Mary of Trnava.

name: Palermo
description: Palermo offers Catholic pilgrims a profound spiritual journey centered on the Sanctuary of Santa Rosalia, patron saint who saved the city from plague and remains beloved throughout Sicily.

name: Tindari
description: Tindari is home to the renowned Sanctuary of the Black Madonna, an important Catholic pilgrimage site in northern Sicily dating back to the 11th century.

name: Covadonga
description: Covadonga is a sacred Catholic pilgrimage site where Our Lady helped King Pelayo win the pivotal Battle of Covadonga in 718, marking the beginning of the Spanish Reconquista and making it Spain's most important Marian sanctuary.

name: Oviedo
description: Oviedo is a historic Catholic pilgrimage site housing the Holy Sudarium of Christ and serving as the starting point of the original Camino Primitivo route to Santiago.

name: Velankanni
description: Velankanni is renowned as the 'Lourdes of the East,' drawing millions of Catholic pilgrims to honor Our Lady of Good Health and witness her miraculous apparitions.

name: Lisbon
description: Lisbon offers rich Catholic heritage as the birthplace of St. Anthony of Padua and gateway to Portugal's spiritual traditions, featuring sacred sites from ancient cathedral to modern sanctuaries.

name: Santarem
description: Santarém is home to the famous Eucharistic Miracle of 1247, one of the most important Catholic pilgrimage sites in Portugal.

name: La Verna
description: La Verna is the sacred mountain sanctuary where Saint Francis of Assisi received the stigmata in 1224, making it one of Christianity's most holy pilgrimage sites.

name: Santa Maria degli Angeli
description: Santa Maria degli Angeli is a major Catholic pilgrimage site housing the sacred Porziuncola chapel where St. Francis founded the Franciscan order.

name: Guadalupe
description: Our Lady of Guadalupe shrine houses the miraculous tilma image of the Virgin Mary, site of her 1531 apparitions to Juan Diego.

name: San Miguel del Milagro
description: Site of 1631 apparition of St. Michael the Archangel, with miraculous healing spring that continues to draw Catholic pilgrims seeking spiritual renewal.

name: Cartago
description: Cartago is Costa Rica's most important Catholic pilgrimage site, home to the Basilica of Our Lady of the Angels where La Negrita, the nation's patron saint, is venerated.

name: Nazareth
description: Nazareth is Jesus' childhood home and the site of the Annunciation, where Gabriel told Mary she would bear the Son of God.

name: Corrientes
description: Corrientes serves as a significant Catholic center in northeastern Argentina, featuring the historic Our Lady of the Rosary Cathedral as its spiritual heart and main pilgrimage destination.

name: Jalisco
description: Jalisco stands as one of Mexico's most important Catholic pilgrimage destinations, home to the renowned Basilica of San Juan de los Lagos with over 7 million annual pilgrims.

name: Cebu City
description: Cebu City holds profound Catholic significance as the birthplace of Christianity in the Philippines, home to the miraculous Santo Niño de Cebú and the country's oldest church.

name: Washington, D.C.
description: Washington, D.C. serves as a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the largest Catholic church in North America and the nation's premier Marian shrine.

name: Barcelona
description: Barcelona offers Catholic pilgrims extraordinary spiritual heritage with Gaudí's masterpiece Sagrada Família and ancient Gothic churches in Catalonia's historic heart.

name: La Vang
description: La Vang is Vietnam's national Marian shrine where Our Lady appeared to persecuted Catholics in 1798, becoming the country's most important Catholic pilgrimage destination.

name: New York City
description: New York City offers rich Catholic heritage with historic cathedrals and shrines, making it a significant pilgrimage destination for faithful visitors.

name: Jerusalem
description: Jerusalem stands as the heart of Christian faith, housing the Church of the Holy Sepulchre where Jesus was crucified, buried, and rose from the dead.

name: Venice
description: Venice offers Catholic pilgrims a unique spiritual journey through St. Mark's Basilica, housing sacred relics of St. Mark the Evangelist and centuries of Christian heritage.

name: Naga City
description: Naga City, known as the Pilgrim City, is home to one of Asia's largest Marian pilgrimage sites centered on devotion to Our Lady of Peñafrancia.

name: Sant'Ambrogio di Torino
description: Home to the renowned Sacra di San Michele abbey, this medieval pilgrimage site honors Archangel Michael along ancient European routes.

name: Aparecida
description: Aparecida is Brazil's most important Marian pilgrimage site, home to the National Shrine of Our Lady Aparecida, the patroness of Brazil, with millions of annual visitors.

name: Manila
description: Manila stands as a premier Catholic pilgrimage destination in Asia, home to the historic Manila Cathedral and revered Black Nazarene shrine that draw millions of faithful annually.

name: Harissa
description: Harissa is home to the National Shrine of Our Lady of Lebanon, the premier Catholic pilgrimage site in Lebanon with a famous Marian statue.

name: Panormitis
description: While primarily an Orthodox site, Panormitis Monastery attracts Catholic pilgrims seeking to honor Archangel Michael, one of Christianity's most revered celestial beings.

name: Haifa - Mount Carmel
description: Mount Carmel in Haifa is sacred to Catholics as the home of Elijah's Cave and the world headquarters of the Carmelite Order, founded by hermits in the 12th century.

name: Goa
description: Goa is a premier Catholic pilgrimage destination housing the sacred relics of St. Francis Xavier, drawing millions to its historic Portuguese colonial churches.

name: Las Lajas
description: Las Lajas Sanctuary is a renowned Catholic pilgrimage site dedicated to Our Lady of Las Lajas, featuring a miraculous Marian image and stunning neo-Gothic architecture.

name: Milan
description: Milan holds profound Catholic significance as the seat of Saint Ambrose and Charles Borromeo, featuring the magnificent Duomo where Saint Augustine was baptized.

name: Los Angeles
description: Los Angeles serves as a major Catholic pilgrimage center with the magnificent Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels and historic California missions offering spiritual significance.

name: Manaoag
description: Manaoag is home to the miraculous Our Lady of the Rosary, drawing millions of pilgrims seeking Marian intercession and healing graces.

name: Chennai
description: Chennai holds special significance as the site where St. Thomas the Apostle was martyred and buried, making it one of Christianity's most important pilgrimage destinations in India.

name: Annaba
description: Annaba hosts the Basilica of Saint Augustine, North Africa's chief Catholic pilgrimage site honoring the great Doctor of the Church.

name: Ramsgate
description: Ramsgate hosts the official Shrine of St Augustine of England, commemorating where the Apostle of the English first brought Christianity in 597 AD.

name: Salerno
description: Salerno is home to the revered Cathedral of Saint Matthew, housing the apostle's relics since 954 AD, making it a significant medieval pilgrimage destination in southern Italy.

name: Ortona
description: Ortona houses the relics of St. Thomas the Apostle in its cathedral, making it a major pilgrimage destination for Christians worldwide seeking spiritual connection.

name: Trier
description: Trier Cathedral houses the Holy Robe of Christ, drawing pilgrims for 500 years to Germany's oldest bishop's church and sanctuary.

name: Patras
description: Patras holds profound Catholic significance as the final resting place of Saint Andrew the Apostle, whose relics draw Christian pilgrims worldwide to venerate this first-called disciple.

name: Amalfi
description: Amalfi hosts the magnificent Cathedral of Saint Andrew, housing the apostle's relics and serving as a major Catholic pilgrimage site on Italy's stunning Amalfi Coast.

name: Saint Catherine
description: Saint Catherine's Monastery houses the relics of St. Catherine of Alexandria and marks the biblical Mount Sinai, making it one of Christianity's most ancient pilgrimage sites.

name: Benevento
description: Benevento is a historic Catholic pilgrimage site in southern Italy, home to the cathedral where Saint Padre Pio was ordained and the ancient Lombard Church of Santa Sophia.

name: Pavia
description: Pavia houses the tomb of St. Augustine of Hippo in San Pietro in Ciel d'Oro, making it a significant pilgrimage destination for Catholics seeking the Doctor of the Church's intercession.

name: Alexandria
description: Alexandria holds profound Catholic significance as the historical seat of St. Mark the Evangelist and center of early Christianity, with St. Catherine's Cathedral serving as the main Catholic pilgrimage destination.

name: Mercogliano
description: Mercogliano is home to the famous Sanctuary of Montevergine, one of Italy's most important Marian shrines and a Benedictine territorial abbey that has drawn pilgrims for centuries.

name: Syracuse
description: Home to the miraculous Basilica of Our Lady of Tears, Syracuse offers pilgrims a profound encounter with Marian devotion and modern Catholic miracles in historic Sicily.

name: Kalisz
description: Kalisz hosts Poland's National Shrine of St. Joseph, one of the world's oldest sanctuaries dedicated to Jesus' earthly father, drawing pilgrims seeking St. Joseph's intercession.

name: Braga
description: Braga, known as the 'Portuguese Rome,' is home to magnificent sanctuaries and churches that have attracted Catholic pilgrims for centuries.

name: Banska Štiavnica
description: Banská Štiavnica is home to Slovakia's most important Baroque pilgrimage complex, the Kalvária Calvary with its three churches and 22 chapels.

name: Congonhas
description: Congonhas is renowned for its UNESCO World Heritage Sanctuary of Bom Jesus de Matosinhos, a magnificent 18th-century Baroque church featuring Aleijadinho's celebrated soapstone sculptures depicting the Stations of the Cross.

name: Predaia
description: Predaia is home to the magnificent Sanctuary of San Romedio, a medieval pilgrimage site clinging to a rocky cliff where Saint Romedius lived as a hermit.

name: Oberammergau
description: Oberammergau is renowned for its Passion Play performed every decade since 1634, making it a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination in Bavaria.

name: L'Aquila
description: L'Aquila is home to the tomb of Pope Celestine V and hosts the annual Celestinian Forgiveness pilgrimage dating back to 1294.

name: Warfhuizen
description: Warfhuizen hosts the northernmost Marian shrine in continental Europe, featuring the Sorrowful Mother statue at Our Lady of the Enclosed Garden hermitage.

name: Guardialfiera
description: Guardialfiera is a historic Catholic pilgrimage site in Molise, home to the ancient Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta which houses precious relics of Saint Gaudentius.

name: Belleville
description: Belleville hosts the National Shrine of Our Lady of the Snows, a major Catholic pilgrimage destination with beautiful devotional spaces.

name: Québec City
description: Québec City is North America's oldest Catholic pilgrimage destination with over 350 years of faith, featuring the renowned Sainte-Anne-de-Beaupré Shrine.

name: Guanajuato (Cristo Rey)
description: The Cristo Rey sanctuary on Cerro del Cubilete is one of Mexico's most important Catholic pilgrimage sites, commemorating the Cristero War martyrs.

name: San Juan
description: San Juan, Texas is home to the Basilica of Our Lady of San Juan del Valle, a major Catholic pilgrimage site welcoming over one million visitors annually to honor Our Lady of San Juan.

name: San Juan de los Lagos
description: San Juan de los Lagos is Mexico's second most important Catholic pilgrimage site, home to the miraculous Virgin of San Juan de los Lagos.

name: Zapopan
description: Zapopan houses the miraculous Virgin of Zapopan, drawing millions annually to celebrate her October 12th pilgrimage and basilica sanctuary.

name: Fonda
description: Fonda hosts the National Shrine of Saint Kateri Tekakwitha, America's first Native American saint, drawing pilgrims to this sacred Mohawk Valley site.

name: Puebla
description: Puebla houses the magnificent Rosary Chapel, considered the crown jewel of Mexican Baroque architecture, drawing countless Catholic pilgrims annually.

name: Philadelphia
description: Philadelphia offers rich Catholic pilgrimage heritage, home to the National Shrine of St. John Neumann, the first American male saint, and numerous sacred sites.

name: La Crosse
description: La Crosse hosts the magnificent Shrine of Our Lady of Guadalupe, a premier Catholic pilgrimage destination founded by Cardinal Burke.

name: Guadalajara
description: Guadalajara stands as a major Catholic pilgrimage center, home to the magnificent Cathedral of the Assumption of Our Lady and millions of faithful visitors annually.

name: Esquipulas
description: Esquipulas is home to the revered Black Christ of Esquipulas, Central America's most important Catholic pilgrimage destination, drawing millions of faithful annually to venerate the miraculous dark wooden crucifix.

name: Champion
description: Champion, Wisconsin hosts America's only Church-approved Marian apparition site, where the Blessed Virgin Mary appeared to Adele Brise in 1859.

name: San Francisco
description: San Francisco offers unique Catholic pilgrimage opportunities with the historic National Shrine of St. Francis of Assisi, established in 1849 and featuring a replica of Assisi's Porziuncola chapel for spiritual renewal without traveling to Italy.

name: Trois-Rivières
description: Home to Canada's national shrine to the Blessed Virgin Mary, Notre-Dame-du-Cap Basilica draws thousands of Catholic pilgrims annually to this sacred Marian site.

name: St. Augustine
description: St. Augustine hosts America's oldest Catholic pilgrimage site, the National Shrine of Our Lady of La Leche, offering 450+ years of faith history and spiritual heritage.

name: San Juan Capistrano
description: Mission Basilica San Juan Capistrano, founded in 1776, stands as California's oldest church still in use and serves as an official National Shrine for Catholic pilgrims seeking spiritual renewal.

name: Auriesville
description: Auriesville is the sacred site where three Jesuit missionaries were martyred in 1642-1646, and the birthplace of St. Kateri Tekakwitha, the 'Lily of the Mohawks'

name: Washington, D.C.
description: Washington, D.C. offers America's premier Catholic pilgrimage experience with the magnificent National Shrine of the Immaculate Conception, the largest church in North America.

name: El Cobre
description: El Cobre houses Cuba's National Shrine Basilica of Our Lady of Charity, the patroness of Cuba. This sacred site draws pilgrims seeking the Virgin's intercession since the 17th century.

name: Hormigueros
description: Hormigueros is renowned as a Catholic pilgrimage destination centered around the historic Basilica of Our Lady of Monserrate, a minor basilica that has drawn faithful devotees for centuries.

name: Emmitsburg
description: Emmitsburg hosts two major Catholic shrines honoring America's first native-born saint and Our Lady of Lourdes, drawing thousands of pilgrims annually to this sacred Maryland town.

name: Mexico City
description: Mexico City houses the world's most visited Catholic shrine, the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe, where millions annually honor the Virgin's miraculous appearance to St. Juan Diego in 1531.

name: Suyapa
description: Home to Honduras' patron saint, Our Lady of Suyapa draws thousands of pilgrims annually to venerate the miraculous 18th-century cedar statue and seek her intercession.

name: Carmel-by-the-Sea
description: Carmel-by-the-Sea is home to the historic Carmel Mission Basilica, final resting place of St. Junipero Serra and one of America's most popular Catholic pilgrimage sites.

name: Higüey
description: Higüey is home to the sacred Basilica of Our Lady of Altagracia, the spiritual heart of Dominican Catholicism and Caribbean pilgrimage.

name: Midland
description: Midland is home to the National Shrine of the Canadian Martyrs, honoring eight Jesuit saints who died for their faith over 350 years ago in Ontario.

name: San Salvador
description: San Salvador stands as a significant Catholic pilgrimage destination, home to the tomb of Saint Óscar Romero and the revered Cathedral of San Salvador.

name: Tlaxcala
description: Tlaxcala is home to two major Catholic pilgrimage sites: the Basilica of Our Lady of Ocotlán and the Shrine of San Miguel del Milagro, drawing faithful seeking miracles.

name: Baltimore
description: Baltimore holds special significance as America's first Catholic diocese and home to the historic Baltimore Basilica, a National Shrine that invites pilgrims to explore the roots of Catholicism in the United States.

name: San Diego
description: San Diego offers Catholic pilgrims significant historic sites including the first California mission and the beautiful St. Joseph Cathedral, making it a meaningful West Coast pilgrimage destination.

name: Cairo
description: Cairo offers profound Catholic pilgrimage sites connected to the Holy Family's flight to Egypt and ancient Christian heritage. Catholic pilgrims visit sacred churches and historical sites throughout the city.

name: Flüeli-Ranft
description: Flüeli-Ranft is the sacred homeland of Switzerland's national saint Nicholas of Flüe (Brother Klaus), where pilgrims seek spiritual guidance at his birthplace and hermitage.

name: Serra San Bruno
description: Home to Saint Bruno of Cologne's tomb and the renowned Carthusian monastery, Serra San Bruno offers pilgrims profound spiritual heritage and tranquility in Calabria's Serre Mountains.

name: Mugnano del Cardinale
description: Mugnano del Cardinale houses the sacred remains of Saint Philomena, making it a significant Catholic pilgrimage site renowned for miraculous healings and devotion.

name: Allens Park
description: Saint Catherine's Chapel on the Rock is a historic Catholic chapel built atop a dramatic rock formation, serving as a spiritual landmark in the Colorado Rockies since 1936.

name: Kolkata
description: Kolkata offers Catholic pilgrims the sacred Mother House of Saint Teresa of Calcutta, where visitors can pray at her tomb and experience her legacy of compassion.

name: Emittsburg
description: Emmitsburg is a sacred Catholic destination home to the National Shrine of Saint Elizabeth Ann Seton and the oldest Lourdes Grotto replica in America.

name: Hulbert
description: Hulbert is home to Our Lady of Clear Creek Abbey, a Traditional Benedictine monastery that serves as the destination for the annual Three Hearts Pilgrimage.

name: KwaZulu-Natal
description: KwaZulu-Natal hosts significant Catholic pilgrimage sites, most notably the Ngome Marian Shrine where Our Lady appeared as 'Tabernacle of the Most High'.

name: New Haven
description: New Haven holds special significance for Catholic pilgrims as the birthplace of the Knights of Columbus and home to Blessed Michael McGivney's tomb.

name: Juneau
description: Juneau's National Shrine of St. Thérèse offers pilgrims a serene spiritual retreat overlooking Lynn Canal, featuring beautiful stone structures and devotional paths.

name: Hansville
description: Hansville Community Church serves as a modest Christian worship site in this scenic coastal community.

name: Tucson
description: Tucson offers Catholic pilgrims spiritual encounters at historic Mission San Xavier del Bac and the Byzantine Mary Undoer of Knots Shrine.

name: Lacrosse
description: La Crosse is home to the magnificent Shrine of Our Lady of Guadalupe, a major Catholic pilgrimage site that draws faithful from across America seeking spiritual renewal and Marian devotion.

name: San Nicolás
description: San Nicolás is home to the Sanctuary of Our Lady of the Rosary, site of approved Marian apparitions and a major Catholic pilgrimage destination in Argentina.

name: Mt. Koressos (Ephesus)
description: Mount Koressos houses the Virgin Mary's final dwelling, a sacred Catholic pilgrimage site where tradition holds she spent her last years under St. John's care.

name: Oklahoma City
description: Oklahoma City stands as a rising Catholic pilgrimage destination with the Blessed Stanley Rother Shrine honoring America's first priest-martyr.

name: San Antonio
description: San Antonio offers a rich Catholic pilgrimage experience through its historic Spanish missions and the National Shrine of the Little Flower, America's first shrine to St. Thérèse of Lisieux.

name: Annaya
description: Annaya is home to the Monastery of Saint Maron, containing the tomb of Saint Charbel Makhlouf, the renowned 19th-century Maronite monk known for miraculous healings.

name: Carmemell
description: The National Shrine of Our Lady of Mount Carmel serves as a major Catholic pilgrimage site dedicated to Marian devotion and Carmelite spirituality.
